pingball.physics

Class Flipper

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Gadget
      • pingball.physics.Flipper

  • public class Flipper
extends Gadget

    A Flipper is a movable Gadget that can hit a ball. A Flipper is designed to fit in a 2L x 2L bounding box regardless of how it is rotating back and forth. The shape of a Flipper is generally rectangular and can be bounded by a 0.5L x 2L rectangle. More specifically a flipper can be thought of as a long rectangle with ends rounded as semi- circles. This equates to two semicirlcs of radius 0.25L on the ends of a .5L x 1.5L box.

    The flipper comes in two varieties, a left flipper and a right flipper. The primary difference between these two is the initial direction in which it rotates. Left flippers begin rotation in the counter-clockwise direction, while right flippers being rotation in the clockwise direction. When triggered, a flipper will rotate in the direction specified by 90 degrees at a rate of 1080 degrees per second. When it is triggered again, the flipper will rotate in the opposite direction by 90 degrees again at 1080 degrees per second. Because flippers rotate back and forth, the primary distinction between a right and left flipper is ONLY it's original orientation and as such a left flipper can be converted into a right flipper through one orientation rotation and a trigger event.

    A flipper by default has a coefficient of reflection of 0.95, however it is important to keep in mind that, similar to the real world, due to the angular momentum of the flipper, a ball that is hit by a rotating flipper can easily fly away with a higher kinetic energy than it started with.

    As a side note, the pivot point in a left flipper at orientation 0 is in the upper left corner of the bounding box, while the pivot point in a right flipper at orientation 0 is in the upper right corner of the bounding box.

    Author:
    Erik

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flipper

        public Flipper(Board board,
       java.lang.String name,
       int x,
       int y,
       Orientation orientation,
       boolean isLeftFlipper)
        Creates a Flipper with coefficient of reflection set to 0.95 and with the desired parameters. A Flipper by default has a 2L x 2L bounding box.
        Parameters:
        board - the board that this flipper is in
        name - the name of this Flipper gadget
        name - the name of the bumper
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= x < 20
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= y < 20
        orientation - the orientation clockwise in degrees from the horizontal that this Flipper is initialized in.
        isLeftFlipper - determines if this flipper is a left or right flipper

      • startAction

        public void startAction()
        Sets up and begins the action sequence associated with this Flipper and adds it to the board active list. If the flipper is already rotating, it makes it start rotating in the other direction

      • checkRep

        protected boolean checkRep()
        All gadgets must follow the rep invariant of Gadget. See gadget for more details. Then the rep invariant is extended such that the flipper angle must be on the interval [0, 360)
        Overrides:
        checkRep in class Gadget
        Returns:
        true if the gadget follows this rep invariant.
